00040 /*
00041  *  OPTIONS
00042  *
00043  *  These are compiler options.  Set each option to one to compile that
00044  *  section of the code.  If a feature is not desired, set the macro
00045  *  to NO.
00046  */
00047 
00048 /* Begin options. */
00049 
00050 /* Arithmetic Precision
00051  *
00052  * The precision of the arithmetic used by Sparse can be set by
00053  * changing changing the spREAL macro.  This macro is
00054  * contained in the file spMatrix.h.  It is strongly suggested to
00055  * used double precision with circuit simulators.  Note that
00056  * because C always performs arithmetic operations in double
00057  * precision, the only benefit to using single precision is that
00058  * less storage is required.  There is often a noticeable speed
00059  * penalty when using single precision.  Sparse internally refers
00060  * to a spREAL as a RealNumber.
00061  */
00062 
00070 #define  REAL                           YES
00071 
00081 #define  EXPANDABLE                     YES
00082 
00101 #define  TRANSLATE                      YES
00102 
00113 #define  INITIALIZE                     YES
00114 
00139 #define  DIAGONAL_PIVOTING              YES
00140 
00154 #define  ARRAY_OFFSET                   NOT FORTRAN
00155 
00176 #define  MODIFIED_MARKOWITZ             NO
00177 
00183 #define  DELETE                         YES
00184 
00188 #define  STRIP                          YES
00189 
00196 #define  MODIFIED_NODAL                 YES
00197 
00205 #define  QUAD_ELEMENT                   YES
00206 
00213 #define  TRANSPOSE                      YES
00214 
00227 #define  SCALING                        YES
00228 
00234 #define  DOCUMENTATION                  YES
00235 
00241 #define  MULTIPLICATION                 YES
00242 
00246 #define  DETERMINANT                    YES
00247 
00258 #define  STABILITY                      YES
00259 
00265 #define  CONDITION                      YES
00266 
00272 #define  PSEUDOCONDITION                YES
00273 
00279 #define  FORTRAN                        YES
00280 
00288 #define  DEBUG                          YES
00289 
00290 #endif /* spINSIDE_SPARSE */
00291 
00292 /*
00293  *  The following options affect Sparse exports and so are exported as a
00294  *  side effect.  For this reason they use the `sp' prefix.  The boolean
00295  *  constants YES an NO are not defined in spMatrix.h to avoid conflicts
00296  *  with user code, so use 0 for NO and 1 for YES.
00297  */
00298 
00303 #define  spCOMPLEX                      1
00304 
00316 #define  spSEPARATED_COMPLEX_VECTORS    0
00317

00463 /*
00464  * PORTABILITY MACROS
00465  */
00466 
00467 #ifdef __STDC__
00468 #   define spcCONCAT(prefix,suffix)        prefix ## suffix
00469 #   define spcQUOTE(x)                     # x
00470 #   define spcFUNC_NEEDS_FILE(func,file)   \
00471                 func ## _requires_ ## file ## _to_be_included_
00472 #else
00473 #   define spcCONCAT(prefix,suffix)        prefixsuffix
00474 #   define spcQUOTE(x)                     "x"
00475 #   define spcFUNC_NEEDS_FILE(func,file)   \
00476                 func_requires_file_to_be_included_
00477 #endif
00478 
00479 #if defined(__cplusplus) || defined(c_plusplus)
00480     /*
00481      * Definitions for C++
00482      */
00483 #   define spcEXTERN            extern "C"
00484 #   define spcNO_ARGS
00485 #   define spcCONST             const
00486     typedef void *spGenericPtr;
00487 #else
00488 #ifdef __STDC__
00489     /*
00490      * Definitions for ANSI C
00491      */
00492 #   define spcEXTERN            extern
00493 #   define spcNO_ARGS           void
00494 #   define spcCONST             const
00495     typedef void *spGenericPtr;
00496 #   else
00497     /*
00498      * Definitions for K&R C -- ignore function prototypes
00499      */
00500 #   define spcEXTERN            extern
00501 #   define spcNO_ARGS
00502 #   define spcCONST
00503     typedef char *spGenericPtr;
00504 #endif
00505 #endif
